Message: Missing ADSL dataset
Description: ADaM Subject level (ADSL) dataset should be included in every submission.

Message: *FL value is not Y, N or null
Description: A variable with a suffix of FL must have value that is Y, N or null (Exception 1: ABLFL, ANLzzFL. Exception 2: Population flags COMPLFL, FASFL, ITTFL, PPROTFL, SAFFL, RANDFL, ENRLFL cannot be null and at least 1 must be included in ADSL).

Message: *FN value is not 0, 1 or null
Description: A variable with a suffix of FN has a value that is not 0, 1, or null (Exception: ABLFN, ANLzzFN, and numeric population flags COMPLFN, FASFN, ITTFN, PPROTFN, SAFFN, RANDFN, ENRLFN cannot be null and at least 1 must be included in ADSL).

Message: Secondary variable *FN is present, but its primary variable *FL is not present
Description: If a Flag Numeric (*FN) variable is present, its corresponding Flag Character (*FL) variable must be present.

Message: *FL = Y and *FN != 1
Description: When a Flag variable (FL) is Y, its corresponding Flag numeric variable (FN) must be 1.

Message: *FL = N and *FN != 0
Description: When a Flag variable (FL) is N, its corresponding Flag numeric variable (FN) must be 0.

Message: Secondary variable *FN is populated, but its primary variable *FL is not populated
Description: When a numeric Flag variable (*FN) is populated, its corresponding character Flag variable (*FL) must be populated.

Message: Illegal variable name: basic format is violated
Description: A variable must be a max of 8 characters, start with a letter A-Z and does not contain anything other than letters, numbers, underscore (_).

Message: Variable label mismatch between dataset and ADaM standard
Description: The variable label in the dataset should match the variable label described in ADaM. When creating a new variable, labels can be adjusted as appropriate. Currently, this rule runs if a variable has a label that is defined in the ADaM metadata.

Message: Variable subject-population flag value is null
Description: For subject-level character population flag variables: N = no (not included), Y = yes (included). Null values are not allowed.

Message: Variable subject-population flag value is null
Description: For subject-level numeric population flag variables: 0 = no (not included), 1 = yes (included). Null values are not allowed.

Message: Inconsistent value for *GRyN
Description: Within a study, all *GRyN values must be the same for each unique value of *GRy when the primary variable *GRy is populated. ADaM IG v1.1 p.15 general variable naming conventions #10: If any combining of the SDTM character categories is done, the name of the derived ADaM character grouping variable should end in GRy and the name of its numeric equivalent should end in GRyN where y is an integer from 1-9 representing a grouping scheme. CDISC created 3 new explicit rules for ADAE which were already covered by this general rule. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for *GRy
Description: Within a study, all *GRy values must be the same for each unique value of *GRyN when the primary variable *GRy is populated. ADaM IG v1.1 p.15 general variable naming conventions #10: If any combining of the SDTM character categories is done, the name of the derived ADaM character grouping variable should end in GRy and the name of its numeric equivalent should end in GRyN where y is an integer from 1-9 representing a grouping scheme. CDISC created 3 new explicit rules for ADAE which were already covered by this general rule. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: *DT does not have the ADaM required SAS Date format
Description: The SAS format listed in the dataset must be valid. Here is a list of SAS Date formats utilized in the rule algorithm: B8601DA, B8601DN , DATE, DAY, DDMMYY, DDMMYYB, DDMMYYC, DDMMYYD, DDMMYYN, DDMMYYP, DDMMYYS, DOWNAME, DTMONYY, E8601DA, JULDAY, JULIAN, MMDDYY, MMDDYYB, MMDDYYC, MMDDYYD, MMDDYYN, MMDDYYP, MMDDYYS, MMYY, MMYYB, MMYYC, MMYYD, MMYYN, MMYYP, MMYYS, MONNAME, MONTH, MONYY, PDJULG, PDJULI, QTR, QTRR, WEEKDATE, WEEKDATX, WEEKDAY, WEEKU, WEEKV, WEEKW, WORDDATE, WORDDATX, YEAR, YYMM, YYMMDD, YYMMDDB, YYMMDDC, YYMMDDD, YYMMDDN, YYMMDDP, YYMMDDS, YYMMB, YYMMC, YYMMD, YYMMN, YYMMP, YYMMS, YYMON, YYQ, YYQB, YYQC, YYQD, YYQN, YYQP, YYQS, YYQR, YYQRB, YYQRC, YYQRD, YYQRN, YYQRP, YYQRS, IS8601DA.

Message: *DT variable has missing SAS Date Format
Description: *DT variables must have non-missing SAS Date Format.

Message: *TM does not have the ADaM required SAS time format
Description: The SAS format listed in the dataset must be valid. Here is a list of SAS Time formats utilized in the rule algorithm: B8601LZ, B8601TM, B8601TZ, E8601LZ, E8601TM, E8601TZ, HHMM, HOUR, MMSS, TIME, TIMEAMPM, IS8601TM, IS8601TZ, TOD.

Message: *TM variable has missing SAS Time Format
Description: *TM variables must have non-missing SAS Time Format.

Message: *DTM does not have the ADaM required SAS Datetime format
Description: The SAS format listed in the dataset must be valid. Here is a list of SAS Date formats utilized in the rule algorithm: B8601DT, B8601DZ, DATEAMPM, DATETIME, DTDATE, DTWKDATX, DTYEAR, DTYYQC, E8601DN, E8601DT, E8601DZ, MDYAMPM, TOD, IS8601DN, IS8601DT, IS8601DZ.

Message: *DTM variable has missing SAS Datetime Format
Description: *DTM variables must have non-missing SAS Datetime Format.

Message: *TM and its corresponding *DTM variable have different time values
Description: When both time and datetime variables are collected on the same record for the same observation, the Time portion of the datetime variable should be equal to the Time variable itself.

Message: *DT and its corresponding *DTM variable have different date values
Description: When both date and datetime variables are collected on the same record for the same observation, the Date portion of the datetime variable should be equal to the Date variable itself.

Message: *DY = 0
Description: A variable with a suffix of DY (day) must not equal zero. Variables whose names end in DY are relative day variables. In ADaM as in the SDTM, there is no day 0. If there is a need to create a relative day variable that includes day 0, then its name must not end in DY.

Message: Required variable is not present
Description: Variables described in ADaM as Required must be included in the dataset.

Message: *FL subject-population flag variable is not present
Description: ADSL must have at least one variable that ends in FL because you need at least one population flag.

Message: The combination of STUDYID and USUBJID value does not exist in the SDTM DM domain
Description: The combination of Study Identifier (STUDYID) and Unique Subject Identifier (USUBJID) is not found in the SDTM Demographics domain. There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: USUBJID duplicate values are not allowed within a study
Description: There should be only one record for a unique value of USUBJID per study in the ADSL dataset.

Message: *DT is not a numeric variable
Description: The SAS TYPE for *DT variable must be equal Num.

Message: *TM is not a numeric variable
Description: The SAS TYPE for *TM variable must be equal Num.

Message: *DTM is not a numeric variable
Description: The SAS TYPE for *DTM variable must be equal Num.

Message: SDTM.EX is present, but neither ADSL TRTSDT nor TRTSDTM are present
Description: The presence of SDTM.EX (Exposure) domain implies that there should be a Treatment Start Date (TRTSDT) / Datetime (TRTSDTM) variable present in the ADaM data.

Message: SDTM.EX is present, but neither ADSL TRTEDT nor TRTEDTM are present
Description: The presence of SDTM.EX (Exposure) domain implies that there should be a Treatment End Date (TRTEDT) / Datetime (TRTEDTM) variable present in the ADaM data. ADaM rule AD0061 corresponds to Start Date and Times. ADaM IG requires it if there is an investigational product.

Message: TRTxxAN is present, but TRTxxA is not present
Description: If Actual Treatment (TRTxxAN) numeric variable is present, there must be a corresponding Actual Treatment (TRTxxA) character variable.

Message: TRxxPGyN is present, but TRxxPGy is not present
Description: If Planned Pooled Treatment y for Period xx (TRxxPGyN) numeric variable is present, there must be a corresponding Planned Pooled Treatment y for Period xx (TRxxPGy) character variable.

Message: TRxxAGyN is present, but TRxxAGy is not present
Description: If Actual Pooled Treatment y for Period xx (TRxxAGyN) numeric variable is present, there must be a corresponding Actual Pooled Treatment y for Period xx (TRxxAGy) character variable.

Message: TRTxxPN is present, but TRTxxP is not present
Description: If the Planned Treatment (TRTxxPN) numeric variable is present, there must be a corresponding Planned Treatment (TRTxxP) character variable.

Message: Inconsistent value for TRTxxPN
Description: Within a study, all TRTxxPN values must be the same for each unique value of TRTxxP when the primary variable TRTxxP is populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for TRTxxP
Description: Within a study, all TRTxxP values must be the same for each unique value of TRTxxPN when the primary variable TRTxxP is populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: TRTxxP is present, but TRxxSDT is not present for periods greater than 01
Description: If Planned Treatment for Period xx (TRTxxP) is present, First Treatment date for period xx (TRxxSDT) must be present if there is more than one Treatment Period. When there is only 1 Treatment Period 01, TRTSDT is sufficient.

Message: TRTxxP is present, but TRxxEDT is not present for periods greater than 01
Description: If Planned Treatment for Period xx (TRTxxP) is present, Last Treatment Date for Period xx (TRxxEDT) must be present if there is more than one Treatment Period. When there is only 1 Treatment Period 01, TRTEDT is sufficient.

Message: TRTxxA is present, but TRTxxP is not present
Description: If Actual Treatment (TRTxxA) is present, its corresponding Planned Treatment (TRTxxP) must be present.

Message: TRTEDT != Maximum TRxxEDT on this record
Description: Date of Last Exposure to Treatment (TRTEDT) for this patient record should be equal to the max Last Treatment Date (TRxxEDT) among all Periods 01 thru xx.

Message: None of the subject-level or record-level treatment variables defined in the ADaMIG are present
Description: At least 1 treatment variable is required in a BDS dataset. This requirement is satisfied by any of the subject-level (ARM, ACTARM, TRTxxP, TRTxxA, TRTSEQP, TRTSEQA, TRxxPGy, TRxxAGy, TSEQPGy, TSEQAGy) or record-level (TRTP, TRTA, TRTPGy, TRTAGy) treatment variables. One is allowed to use any treatment variable in analysis of BDS. Any subject-level treatment variable may be copied into the BDS dataset from ADSL.

Message: Inconsistent value for TRTPN
Description: Within a study, all TRTPN values must be the same for each unique value of TRTP when the primary variable TRTP is populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for TRTP
Description: Within a study, all TRTP values must be the same for each unique value of TRTPN when the primary variable TRTP is populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for TRTAN
Description: Within a study, all TRTAN values must be the same for each unique value of TRTA when the primary variable TRTA is populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for TRTA
Description: Within a study, all TRTA values must be the same for each unique value of TRTAN when the primary variable TRTA is populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: TRTPGyN is present, but TRTPGy is not present
Description: If Planned Pooled Treatment y (TRTPGyN) numeric variable is present, there must be a corresponding Planned Pooled Treatment y (TRTPGy) character variable.

Message: *SDY is greater than *EDY
Description: Any variable ending in SDY (Start day) must have a value less than or equal to its corresponding EDY (end day) value.

Message: *STDY is greater than *ENDY
Description: Any variable ending in STDY (Start day) must have a value less than or equal to its corresponding ENDY (end day) value.

Message: There is no TRTxxP variable in ADSL for every unique xx value of APERIOD
Description: The Analysis Period (APERIOD) values will be a number like 01. There must be a corresponding Planned Treatment for Period xx variable (like TRT01P) in ADSL dataset.

Message: There is no TRxxSDT variable in ADSL for every unique xx value of APERIOD
Description: The Analysis Period (APERIOD) values will be a number like 01. There must be a corresponding Date of First Exposure in Period xx variable for this period (like TR01SDT) in ADSL dataset.

Message: There is no TRxxEDT variable in ADSL for every unique xx value of APERIOD
Description: The Analysis Period (APERIOD) values will be a number like 01. There must be a corresponding Date of Last Exposure in Period xx variable for this period (like TR01EDT) in ADSL dataset.

Message: Inconsistent value for APERIODC
Description: Within a study, all APERIODC values must be the same for each unique value of APERIOD when the primary variable APERIOD is populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for APERIOD
Description: Within a study, all APERIOD values must be the same for each unique value of APERIODC when the primary variable APERIOD is populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for AVISITN
Description: Within a study, all AVISITN values must be the same for each unique value group of [PARAMCD, AVISIT] when PARAMCD and primary variable AVISIT are populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for AVISIT
Description: Within a study, all AVISIT values must be the same for each unique value group of [PARAMCD, AVISITN] when PARAMCD and primary variable AVISIT are populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: ARELTM is present, but ARELTMU is not present
Description: When ARELTM is present, the Anchor Time variable and ARELTMU (Analysis Relative Time unit) must also be included in the dataset, and the anchor time variable must be identified in the metadata for ARELTM.

Message: Only one of these variables is populated: ARELTM, ARELTMU
Description: If ARELTMU (Analysis Relative Time unit) or ARELTM (Analysis Relative Time) is populated, then both must be populated together.

Message: ARELTMU is present, but ARELTM is not present
Description: When ARELTM is present, the anchor time variable and ARELTMU must also be included in the dataset, and the anchor time variable must be identified in the metadata for ARELTM.

Message: Inconsistent value for ATPT
Description: Within a study, all ATPT values must be the same for each unique value group of [PARAMCD, ATPTN] when PARAMCD and primary variable ATPT are populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for ATPTN
Description: Within a study, all ATPTN values must be the same for each unique value group of [PARAMCD, ATPT] when PARAMCD and primary variable ATPT are populated. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: *SDT is greater than *EDT
Description: "Any variable ending in SDT (Start Date) must have a value less than or equal to its corresponding EDT (End Date) value (e.g., ADSL - TRTSDT, TR01SDT, AP01SDT

Message: *SDTM is greater than *EDTM
Description: "Any variable ending in SDTM (Start Date Time) must have a value less than or equal to its corresponding EDTM (End Date Time) value (e.g., ADSL - TRTSDTM, TR01SDTM, AP01SDTM

Message: Inconsistent value for PARAMTYP
Description: Within a study, all PARAMTYP values must be the same for each unique value of PARAMCD when PARAMCD is populated. If a PARAMCD is said to be derived, all instances must be derived. More than one parameter can be derived.

Message: Inconsistent value for PARCATy within a unique PARAMCD
Description: Within a study, all PARCATy values must be the same for each unique value of PARAMCD when PARAMCD is populated. A Parameter can only be categorized once. However, that Category can be used across PARAMs.

Message: Inconsistent value for PARCATy
Description: Within a study, all PARCATy values must be the same for each unique value of PARCATyN when both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for PARCATyN
Description: Within a study, all PARCATyN values must be the same for each unique value of PARCATy when both variables are populated.

Message: BASE or BASEC is populated for a unique USUBJID, PARAMCD, but no baseline record exists
Description: Within a given Subject's PARAMCD, a baseline value is populated (either BASE or BASEC) and there is not at least one record in that group marked as the baseline (ABLFL = Y).

Message: BASE or BASEC is present, but ABLFL is not present
Description: ABLFL is required if BASE or BASEC is present in the dataset.

Message: Inconsistent value for BASE
Description: Within a study, all BASE values must be the same for each unique value group of [PARAMCD, BASEC] when PARAMCD, BASE and BASEC are populated (ADaM IG: There must be a one-to-one map between BASE and BASEC within a given PARAM if BOTH are populated).

Message: Inconsistent value for BASEC
Description: Within a study, all BASEC values must be the same for each unique value group of [PARAMCD, BASE] when PARAMCD, BASE and BASEC are populated. (ADaM IG: There must be a one-to-one map between BASE and BASEC within a given PARAM if BOTH are populated).

Message: Calculation issue: R2BASE != AVAL / BASE
Description: When all 3 variables are populated and BASE does not equal 0, Ratio to Base (R2BASE) must equal Analysis Value (AVAL) / Baseline Value (BASE). AD0132A will raise errors when BASE equals 0. AD0132B also complements this check.

Message: Calculation issue: BASE = 0, but R2BASE is populated
Description: When baseline (BASE) equals 0, the Ratio to Baseline (R2BASE) should not be populated since you cannot divide by 0. AD0132 checks the RSBASE calculation is correct when BASE does not equal 0.

Message: Calculation issue: CHG, PCHG or R2BASE is populated, but AVAL and/or BASE are not present and populated
Description: If any of CHG (change), PCHG (percent change), or R2BASE (ratio of Analysis Value to Base) is populated, the values necessary for its calculation must both be present and populated. CHG = AVAL - BASE, PCHG = (AVAL - BASE)/BASE * 100, R2BASE = AVAL / BASE. Once this issue is resolved, there is greater potential for rules AD0132, AD0225, AD0223 to fire.

Message: Calculation issue: R2AyLO != AVAL / AyLO
Description: When all 3 variables are populated and AyLO does not equal 0, Ratio to AyLO (R2AyLO) must equal Analysis Value (AVAL) / Analysis Range y LO Value (AyLO).

Message: Calculation issue: R2AyLO is present, but AVAL and/or AyLO is not present
Description: R2AyLO = AVAL / AyLO. therefore if R2AyLO is present, both AVAL and AyLO must be present for calculation consistency.

Message: Calculation issue: R2AyLO is populated, but AVAL and/or AyLO are not populated
Description: If R2AyLO is populated, the values necessary for its calculation must both be present and populated. R2AyLO = AVAL / AyLO. Once this issue is resolved, there is greater potential for AD0133 to fire.

Message: Calculation issue: AyLO = 0, but R2AyLO is populated
Description: When Analysis Range Low (AyLO) equals 0, the Ratio to Analysis Range Low (R2AyLO) should not be populated since you cannot divide by 0. AD0133 checks the calculation is correct when AyLO does not equal 0.

Message: Calculation issue: R2AyHI != AVAL / AyHI
Description: When all 3 variables are populated and AyHI does not equal 0, Ratio to AyHI (R2AyHI) must equal Analysis Value (AVAL) / Analysis Range y HI Value (AyHI).

Message: Calculation issue: R2AyHI is present, but AVAL and/or AyHI is not present
Description: R2AyHI = AVAL / AyHI. Therefore, if R2AyHI is present, both AVAL and AyHI must be present for calculation consistency.

Message: Calculation issue: R2AyHI is populated, but AVAL and/or AyHI are not populated
Description: If R2AyHI is populated, the values necessary for its calculation must both be present and populated. R2AyHI = AVAL / AyHI. Once this issue is resolved, there is greater potential for AD0134 to fire.

Message: Calculation issue: AyHI = 0, but R2AyHI is populated
Description: When Analysis Range High (AyHI) = 0, the Ratio to Analysis Range High (R2AyHI) should not be populated since you cannot divide by 0. AD0134 checks the calculation is correct when AyLO != '0'.

Message: Inconsistent value for SHIFTy
Description: Within a study, all SHIFTy values must be the same for each unique value of SHIFTyN when PARAMCD, SHIFTy, and SHIFTyN variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for SHIFTyN
Description: Within a study, all SHIFTyN values must be the same for each unique value of SHIFTy when PARAMCD, SHIFTy, and SHIFTyN variables are populated.

Message: CRITyFL is populated, but CRITy is not populated
Description: When CRITyFL (Analysis Criterion Flag) is populated, it's corresponding parent Analysis Criterion y must be populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for PARAM within a unique PARAMCD
Description: Within a study, All PARAM values must be the same for each unique value of PARAMCD when both PARAMCD and PARAM are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for PARAMCD within a unique PARAM
Description: Within a study, All PARAMCD values must be the same for each unique value of PARAM when both PARAMCD and PARAM are populated.

Message: Illegal PARAMCD value
Description: PARAMCD value must be a max of 8 characters, start with a letter A-Z or underscore, and not contain anything other than letters, numbers, or underscore (_).

Message: Inconsistent value for PARAM
Description: Within a study, all PARAM values must be the same for each unique value of PARAMN when both variables PARAM and PARAMN are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for PARAMN
Description: Within a study, all PARAMN values must be the same for each unique value of PARAM when both variables PARAM and PARAMN are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for AVALC
Description: Within a study and a given value of PARAMCD when both AVAL and AVALC are populated, then all AVALC values must be the same for each unique value of AVAL creating a one-to-one mapping. Considering only those rows on which both variables are populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for AVAL
Description: Within a study and a given value of PARAMCD when both AVAL and AVALC are populated, then all AVAL values must be the same for each unique value of AVALC creating a one-to-one mapping.

Message: Inconsistent value for CRITy within a unique PARAMCD
Description: Within a study, all CRITy values must be the same for each unique value of PARAMCD when PARAMCD and CRITy are populated. Example: PARAMCD = SYSBP (mm Hg), CRIT1 = SYSBP >160.

Message: ABLFL = Y, but BASE != AVAL
Description: If the record is flagged as the baseline (ABLFL = Y), then the baseline Value (BASE) must equal the Analysis Value (AVAL).

Message: Multiple baseline records exist for a unique USUBJID, PARAMCD, BASETYPE
Description: For a set of [Subject (USUBJID), Parameter (PARAMCD), baseline type (BASETYPE)] only one record can be the actual baseline value, marked by ABLFL = Y.

Message: CRITyFL is present, but CRITy is not present
Description: If Criterion y Flag (CRITyFL) variable is present, there must also be a corresponding Criterion y (CRITy) variable.

Message: CRITy is present, but CRITyFL is not present
Description: If Criterion y (CRITy) variable is present, there must also be a corresponding Criterion y Flag (CRITyFL) variable.

Message: Calculation issue: AWTDIFF is populated, but AWTARGET and/or one of [ADY, ARELTM] are not both present and populated
Description: If AWTDIFF (Analysis Window Diff from Target) is populated AWTARGET (Analysis Window Target) must be populated. AWTDIFF = Absolute value of (ADY or ARELTM) - AWTARGET. Note: A future rule should validate that the calculation is correct. Rule enhanced by Pinnacle 21 to include ADY and ARELTM. If only AWTDIFF is present and populated, this rule will fire even if some or all other variables are not present. This may fire simultaneously with AD0158.

Message: AWU is present, but both AWLO and AWHI are not present
Description: If Analysis Window Unit (AWU) variable is present, then Analysis Window Beginning Timepoint (AWLO) and (Analysis Window Ending Timepoint) AWHI variables must be present.

Message: BTOXGR is present, but ATOXGR is not present
Description: If Baseline Toxicity Grade (BTOXGR) variable is present, then Analysis Toxicity Grade (ATOXGR) and Baseline Record Flag (ABLFL) variables must be present.

Message: BTOXGR is present, but ABLFL is not present
Description: If Baseline Toxicity Grade (BTOXGR) variable is present, then Analysis Toxicity Grade (ATOXGR) and Baseline Record Flag (ABLFL) variables must be present.

Message: ABLFL = Y, but BTOXGR != ATOXGR
Description: If the record is flagged as the baseline (ABLFL = Y), then the baseline toxicity grade (BTOXGR) value must equal the analysis toxicity grade (ATOXGR) value.

Message: BNRIND is present, but ANRIND is not present
Description: If Baseline Reference Range Indicator (BNRIND) variable is present, then Analysis Reference Range Indicator (ANRIND) and Baseline Record Flag (ABLFL) variables must be present.

Message: BNRIND is present, but ABLFL is not present
Description: If Baseline Reference Range Indicator (BNRIND) variable is present, then Analysis Reference Range Indicator (ANRIND) and Baseline Record Flag (ABLFL) variables must be present.

Message: ABLFL = Y, but BNRIND != ANRIND
Description: If the record is flagged as the baseline (ABLFL = Y), then the baseline normal range indicator (BNRIND) value must equal the analysis normal range indicator (ANRIND) value.

Message: CNSR is not an integer >= 0
Description: Censor (CNSR) value must be an integer. Defines whether the event was censored (period of observation truncated prior to event being observed). It is strongly recommended to use 0 as an event indicator and positive integers as censoring indicators. It is also recommended that unique positive integers be used to indicate coded descriptions of censoring reasons. CNSR is required for time-to-event parameters.

Message: ABLFL value is not Y or null
Description: Analysis Baseline Flag character (ABLFL) must be Y or null. For parameter-level and record-level character population flag variables: Y = yes (included). Null values are allowed.

Message: ANLzzFL value is not Y or null
Description: A variable of form ANLzzFL (analysis record flag) must be Y or null.

Message: Required Variable value is null
Description: Unlike SDTM, only some of ADaM Required variables (where Core attribute is 'Req') must be populated. CDISC ADaM rules affirm that PARAM and PARAMCD must be populated, while others are populated as appropriate. Known Exceptions: TRTP, TRTxxP, AGE, AGEU, RACE, SUBJID, AESER.

Message: Neither AVAL nor AVALC are present in dataset
Description: At least one Analysis Value (numeric or character) variable must be present in BDS datasets.

Message: TRTAGyN is present, but TRTAGy is not present
Description: If Actual Pooled Treatment y (TRTAGyN) numeric variable is present, there must be a corresponding Planned Pooled Treatment y (TRTPGy) character variable.

Message: For the same USUBJID, the ADSL.AGE != DM.AGE
Description: The same subject in ADSL and DM must have the same value for Age (AGE). There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: For the same USUBJID, the ADSL.AGEU != DM.AGEU
Description: The same subject in ADSL and DM must have the same value for Age Unit (AGEU). There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: For the same USUBJID, the ADSL.SEX != DM.SEX
Description: The same subject in ADSL and DM must have the same value for Sex (SEX). There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: For the same USUBJID, the ADSL.RACE != DM.RACE
Description: The same subject in ADSL and DM must have the same value for Race (RACE). There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: For the same USUBJID, the ADSL.SUBJID != DM.SUBJID
Description: The same subject in ADSL and DM must have the same value for Subject ID (SUBJID). There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: For the same USUBJID, the ADSL.SITEID != DM.SITEID
Description: The same subject in ADSL and DM must have the same value for Site ID (SITEID). There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: For the same USUBJID, the ADSL.ARM != DM.ARM
Description: The same subject in ADSL and DM must have the same value for Arm (ARM). There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: ABLFN value is not 1 or null
Description: ABLFN (Analysis Baseline Flag Numeric) must be 1 or null. For Parameter-Level and Record-Level Numeric Population Flag variables: 1 = yes (included). Null values are allowed.

Message: ANLzzFN value is not 1 or null
Description: ANLzzFN (Analyzed Record Flag zz Numeric) must be 1 or null. For Parameter-Level and Record-Level Numeric Population Flag variables: 1 = yes (included). Null values are allowed.

Message: Inconsistent value for *CATy
Description: Within a study, all Category y (*CATy) variable values must be the same for each unique value of the variable it categorizes within a PARAMCD. [AVAL:AVALCATy], [AVALC:AVALCATy], [BASE:BASECATy], [BASEC:BASECATy], [CHG:CHGCATy], [PCHG:PCHGCATy], [BCHG:BCHGCATy]. A Category may be the same across values.

Message: Calculation issue: CHG != AVAL - BASE
Description: When all 3 variables are populated, Change from Baseline (CHG) must equal Analysis Value (AVAL) minus Baseline Value (BASE).

Message: Calculation issue: PCHG != (AVAL - BASE)/BASE * 100
Description: When all 3 variables are populated and base <> 0, Percent Change from Baseline (PCHG) must equal the difference of Analysis Value (AVAL) minus Baseline Value (BASE) divided by the Baseline Value (BASE), expressed as a percentage. AD0225A will raise errors when BASE = 0. AD0132B also complements this check.

Message: Calculation issue: BASE = 0, but PCHG is populated
Description: When Baseline (BASE) equals 0, the Percent Change from Baseline (PCHG) should not be populated since you cannot divide by 0. AD0225 checks the PCHG calculation is correct when BASE does not equal 0. AD0132B also complements this rule.

Message: CNSR is present, but STARTDT is not present
Description: When Censor (CNSR) variable is present, the Time-to-Event Origin Date for Subject (STARTDT) and one of Analysis Date (ADT) or Analysis Datetime (ADTM) variables must be included in the dataset. In Time to Event studies, the basis of analysis is the time from a defined starting point to the time of occurrence of the event of interest.

Message: CNSR is present, but both ADT and ADTM are not present
Description: When Censor (CNSR) variable is present, the Time-to-Event Origin Date for Subject (STARTDT) and one of Analysis Date (ADT) or Analysis Datetime (ADTM) variables must be included in the dataset. In Time to Event studies, the basis of analysis is the time from a defined starting point to the time of occurrence of the event of interest.

Message: CNSR is populated, but AVAL, STARTDT, and one of [ADT, ADTM] are not populated
Description: When an event is censored, 3 other variables must be populated. Censor (CNSR) variable qualifies the Analysis Value (AVAL) variable. ADT and ADTM variables are the Analysis Date and Time of event or censoring associated with AVAL. Origin Date for Subject (STARTDT) variable is the original date of risk for the time-to-event analysis. This is generally the time at which a subject is first at risk for the event of interest evaluation.

Message: EVNTDESC and/or CNSDTDSC is present, but CNSR is not present
Description: In Time to Event studies, Event or Censoring Description (EVNTDESC) variable is the description of the event of interest or an event that warrants censoring. Therefore, Censor (CNSR) variable should be present. Censor Date Description (CNSDTDSC) variable describes the circumstance represented by the censoring date if different from the event date that warrants censoring. If present, CNSR must be present. Note that adding CNSDTDSC provides additional information when there is a difference between the event date that warrants censoring and the actual date of censoring. If the event that warrants censoring is the same as the onset date of the event that represents the censoring date, then the CNSDTDSC column is not needed in the analysis dataset.

Message: CNSDTDSC is present, but CNSR is not present
Description: In Time to Event studies, Censor Date Description (CNSDTDSC) variable describes the circumstance represented by the censoring date if different from the event date that warrants censoring. If present, Censor (CNSR) variable must be present. Note that adding CNSDTDSC provides additional information when there is a difference between the event date that warrants censoring and the actual date of censoring. If the event that warrants censoring is the same as the onset date of the event that represents the censoring date, then the CNSDTDSC column is not needed in the analysis dataset.

Message: Variable present in dataset is prohibited for use in ADaM
Description: Variables described in ADaM IG as inappropriate for usage must be not included in the dataset. i.e., for ADAE, there is no need for AVAL, AVALC and Parameter variables.

Message: Record key from SDTM AE is not traceable to ADaM ADAE (not enough ADAE recs)
Description: Adverse Events specified in SDTM AE domain must be traceable to ADaM ADAE dataset based on Study Identifier (STUDYID), Unique Subject Identifier (USUBJID) and Sequence Number (AESEQ) variables. The ADAE structure for the standard adverse event safety dataset must have at least one record per each AE recorded in SDTM AE domain. However, subjects not analyzed (e.g., Screen Failures) who have AEs recorded in SDTM AE, but not in ADSL do not need to be included in ADAE. Currently, this check does not take into account the latter. Please check your ADSL file to see if these issues are for Screen Failures.

Message: USUBJID value does not exist in the ADaM ADSL domain
Description: All subjects included into ADaM datasets should be present in ADSL dataset and use the same Unique Subject Identifier (USUBJID).

Message: Record key from ADaM ADAE is not traceable to SDTM.AE (extra ADAE recs)
Description: Adverse Events specified in ADAE dataset must be traceable to the SDTM AE domain based on Study Identifier (STUDYID), Unique Subject Identifier (USUBJID) and Sequence Number (AESEQ) variables. ADaM ADAE dataset should be validated with SDTM AE domain to facility this check. There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM study data. This usually refers to mapping issues since an ADaM ADAE records must have been born from SDTM AE domain.

Message: Variable flag value is not Y or null
Description: A Treatment Flag variable must have a value that is Y or null. Examples of such Flags variables in ADaM-IG 1.2 are Treatment Emergent Analysis Flag (TRTEMFL), Pre-treatment Flag (PREFL), On Treatment Record Flag (ONTRTFL), Follow-up Flag (FUPFL), and Last Value On Treatment Record Flag (LVOTFL).

Message: Variable flag value is not Y or null
Description: 1st Occurrence * Flag (AOCC*FL) variable values must be Y or null.

Message: Illegal variable name: zz is not in [01-99] for AOCCzzFL
Description: For additional Flag (AOCCzzFL) variables representing the 1st Occurrence of an analysis event or datapoint, zz must be nth flag variable (01 to 99). The main purpose of these flags is to facilitate data point traceability between records in the dataset and unique counts in the summary displays. In addition, if a Time to Event (TTE) Analysis dataset is built off of Adverse Events, the flags provide a crucial link between the summary records in the TTE BDS and the source of the records in ADAE. If the producer of the ADAE dataset has standard programs in place to summarize unique counts of events, then they may choose not to create these flags.

Message: Variable value != 1, 2, 3, or null
Description: Severity/Intensity (N) (AESEVN) and Analysis Severity/Intensity (N) (ASEVN) variables must have values in [1, 2, 3] when populated. AESEVN can be null. ASEVN cannot be null.

Message: Illegal variable name: zz is not in [01-99] for SMQzz(NAM, CD, SC, SCN)
Description: For Standardized MedDRA Query Variables of Name, Code and Scope(N), zz must be the ordered SMQ of interest (01 to 99). This ordering can be based on importance or some other sponsor-defined criteria. It is recommended that the ordering be consistent across studies within a development program.

Message: Illegal variable name: zz is not in [01-99] for CQzzNAM
Description: For Customized MedDRA Query Name (SMQzzNAM) variables , zz must be the ordered CQ of interest (01 to 99). This ordering can be based on importance or some other sponsor-defined criteria. It is recommended that the ordering be consistent across studies within a development program.

Message: Only some of these variables are present and populated: SMQzzNAM, SMQzzCD, SMQzzSC
Description: If any of SMQ Name (SMQzzNAM), SMQ Code (SMQzzCD) or SMQ Scope (SMQzzSC) variable is populated, then all of these MedDRA SMQ variables must be populated together.

Message: Inconsistent value for SMQzzSC
Description: Across studies, all SMQ Scope (SMQzzSC ) variable values must be the same for each unique value of SMQ Scope (N) (SMQzzSCN) variable when both variables are populated. The usual mapping is BROAD=1, NARROW=2.

Message: Inconsistent value for SMQzzSCN
Description: Across studies, all SMQ Scope (N) (SMQzzSCN) variable values must be the same for each unique value of SMQ Scope (SMQzzSC ) variable when both variables are populated. The usual mapping is BROAD=1, NARROW=2.

Message: SMQzzSC value != BROAD, NARROW or null
Description: Standardized MedDRA Query Scope (SMQzzSC) variable value must be BROAD, NARROW, or null. The search strategy for SMQs can be narrow or broad. The preferred terms that are narrow in scope have high specificity for identifying events of interest while the broad terms have high sensitivity. By definition, all narrow terms are also considered within the broad score. Therefore, to summarize all broad terms, terms with either narrow OR broad would be considered. Will be null for terms that do not meet the criteria. Conditional on whether SMQ analysis is done.

Message: SMQzzSCN value != 1, 2 or null
Description: Standardized MedDRA Query Scope Numeric (SMQzzSCN) variable value must be 1 (BROAD), 2 (NARROW), or null. The search strategy for SMQs can be narrow or broad. The preferred terms that are narrow in scope have high specificity for identifying events of interest while the broad terms have high sensitivity. By definition, all narrow terms are also considered within the broad score. Therefore, to summarize all broad terms, terms with either narrow OR broad would be considered. Will be null for terms that do not meet the criteria. Conditional on whether SMQ analysis is done.

Message: Inconsistent value for AyLO
Description: Within a Study and a Parameter, all Analysis Range y Lower Limit( AyLO) variable values must be the same for each unique value of Analysis Range y Lower Limit (C) (AyLOC) variable when variable AyLOC is populated.

Message: Inconsistent value for DTHCAUSN

Message: Value of ASTDT is greater than value of AENDT

Message: DOSEU variable is not present when DOSEON or DOSCUMA is present

Message: Missing RANDDT variable when RANDFL variable is present

Message: RANDFL value is not Y when RANDDT is populated
Description: Randomized Population Flag (RANDFL) variable value should be 'Y' for randomized subject (when Date of Randomization (RANDDT) variable value is populated).

Message: For the same USUBJID, the ADSL.ACTARM != DM.ACTARM
Description: The same subject in ADSL and DM datasets must have the same value for Actual Arm (ACTARM). There must be traceability between ADaM and SDTM.

Message: *DTF is populated, but *DT or *DTM is not populated

Message: *TMF is populated, but *TM or *DTM is not populated

Exceptions: *DTC, *FN, TRTPN, TRT01PN, PARAMN, AVALC, BASEC, AVISITN. Corresponding character and numeric values must also have a one-to-one mapping consistency when the primary variable is populated, which are addressed in other rules.

Description: Within a parameter, there should be only a single value of a primary variable (*) for a given value of secondary variable (*N), considering only those rows on which both variables are populated. Message: Inconsistent value for BTOXGRLN within a unique PARAMCD

Message: Secondary variable is populated, but its primary variable * is not populated
Description: In a pair of corresponding character and numeric variables (* and *N or *C) the primary or most commonly used variable must be populated if its secondary variable describing it is populated. Exceptions: *DTC, *FN, TRTPN, TRT01PN, PARAMN, AVALC, BASEC, *LOC, and *HIC. Corresponding character and numeric values must also have a one-to-one mapping consistency when the primary variable is populated, which are addressed in other rules.

Message: Secondary variable is present, but its primary variable is not present
Description: In a pair of corresponding character and numeric variables, the primary or most commonly used variable must be present if its secondary version describing it (*N or *C) is present. This is a rule designed to look explicitly at variable pairs defined in the CDISC standard documents. A similar rule that checks custom *N or *C variables (with a few exceptions) is AD1012. This rule is expected to be added to CDISC ADaM Conformance Rules in the future.

Message: Illegal variable name: zz is not in [01-99] for ANLzzFL/FN
Description: For Analysis Flag zz (ANLzzFL) and Analysis Flag zz (N) (ANLzzFN) variables, 'zz' is an index for the zzth record selection algorithm where 'zz' is must be in [01-99]. Similar to CDISC ADaM Validation Checks No. 299-303.

Message: Illegal variable name: xx is not in [01-99] for an ADSL trial date
Description: For ADSL Trial Dates xx variables of form TRxx... and APxx..., 'xx' must be the treatment period (01 to 99). This rule covers 20 distinct variable forms listed in ADSL. It's anticipated that the CDISC ADaM Validation team will release 20 new rules to cover this scenario.

Message: Traceability rules not executed due to missing DM dataset
Description: When validating ADaM datasets, the DM dataset must also be included to ensure traceability. Note: For the final submission the eCTD structure should be maintained. Therefore, the SDTM and ADaM datasets should be submitted in their appropriate locations. Do not include the DM dataset in the ../analysis/adam/datasets folder.

Message: Traceability rules not executed due to missing AE dataset
Description: When validating ADaM datasets, the AE dataset must also be included to ensure traceability. Note: For the final submission the eCTD structure should be maintained. Therefore, the SDTM and ADaM datasets should be submitted in their appropriate locations. Do not include the AE dataset in the ../analysis/adam/datasets folder.

Message: Traceability rules not executed due to missing EX dataset
Description: When validating ADaM datasets, the EX dataset must also be included to ensure traceability. Note: For the final submission the eCTD structure should be maintained. Therefore, the SDTM and ADaM datasets should be submitted in their appropriate locations. Do not include the EX dataset in the ../analysis/adam/datasets folder.

Message: The combination of STUDYID and USUBJID value from SDTM DM does not exist in ADSL
Description: The combination of Study Identifier (STUDYID) and Unique Subject Identifier (USUBJID) values in ADaM Analysis Subject Level (ADSL) dataset should be populated by values of the same variables from the study SDTM Demographics (DM) domain.

Message: Dataset not validated
Description: Validation is defined only for ADSL, BDS, and OCCDS datasets. Other dataset structures are not currently supported.

Message: Variable value not found in non-extensible codelist
Description: Variable must be populated with terms from its CDISC controlled terminology codelist. New terms cannot be added into non-extensible codelists.

Message: Variable value not found in extensible codelist
Description: Variable should be populated with terms from its CDISC controlled terminology codelist. New terms can be added as long as they are not duplicates, synonyms or subsets of existing standard terms.

Message: Coded and Decoded values do not have the same Code in CDISC CT
Description: Paired variables such as TEST/TESTCD must be populated using terms with the same Codelist Code value in CDISC control terminology. There is one-to-one relationship between paired variable values defined in CDISC control terminology by Codelist Code value.

Message: Variable value not found in non-extensible codelist when value-level condition occurs
Description: Variable must be populated with terms from its CDISC controlled terminology codelist when its value level condition is met. New terms cannot be added into non-extensible codelists.

Message: Variable value not found in extensible codelist when value-level condition occurs
Description: Variable should be populated with terms from its CDISC controlled terminology codelist when its value level condition is met. New terms can be added as long as they are not duplicates, synonyms or subsets of existing standard terms.

Message: Coded and Decoded values do not have the same Code in CDISC CT when value-level condition occurs
Description: Paired variables such as TEST/TESTCD must be populated using terms with the same Codelist Code value in CDISC control terminology. There is one-to-one relationship between paired variable values defined in CDISC control terminology by Codelist Code value within the same value level condition.

Message: Missing define.xml file
Description: Guidance provided by regulatory agencies states that eCTD submissions must include a define.xml file for each study in Module 4 (nonclinical) and Module 5 (clinical). Note: Refer to the data standards catalog by the relevant Regulatory Agency for acceptance of standards and their versions.

Message: No records in data source
Description: Domain table should have at least one record.

Message: Value for variable not found in user-defined codelist
Description: Variable values should be populated with terms found in the user-defined codelist associated with the variable in define.xml.

Message: Variable in define.xml is not present in the dataset
Description: Variables listed in the data definition document (define.xml) should be included in the dataset.

Message: Define.xml/dataset variable type mismatch
Description: Variable DataType in define.xml must match variable Type in dataset. Define-XML data types of 'integer' and 'float' match dataset type of 'Num', all other match 'Char'.

Message: Variable in dataset is not present in define.xml
Description: Variables included in the dataset must be described in the data definition document (define.xml).

Message: Domain referenced in define.xml, but dataset is missing
Description: Domains referenced in data definition document (define.xml) should be included in the submission.

Message: Incompatible data source
Description: Domain table must have a valid format (e.g., SAS transport (XPORT) v.5 or text-delimited).

Message: Dataset is not present in define.xml
Description: Datasets included in study data must be described in the data definition document (define.xml).

Message: Dataset is greater than 5 GB in size
Description: Datasets greater than 5 gigabytes (GB) in size should be split into smaller datasets no larger than 5 GB.

Message: Variable length is too long for actual data
Description: Variable length should be assigned based on actual stored data to minimize file size. Datasets should be re-sized to the maximum length of actual data used prior to splitting.

Message: Variable value not found in user-defined codelist when value-level condition occurs
Description: Variable value must be populated with terms from user-defined value level codelist as specified in define.xml file.

Message: Variable value is null when value-level condition occurs
Description: Variable value must be populated when value level attribute Mandatory='Yes' as specified in define.xml file.

Message: Variable datatype is not %Variable.@Clause.DataType% when value-level condition occurs
Description: Value level datatype must match the datatype described in define.xml.

Message: Variable value is longer than defined max length %Variable.@Clause.Length% when value-level condition occurs
Description: Value level length must not exceed the length as specified define.xml.

Message: Define.xml/dataset variable label mismatch
Description: Variable Label in define.xml must match variable Label in dataset.

Message: Define.xml/dataset description mismatch
Description: Dataset Description in define.xml must match dataset Description.

Message: Invalid value for Dataset Name
Description: Dataset Name (DATASET) should follow limitations of SAS XPORT format v5. It should not exceed 8 characters and cannot contain characters other than letters in upper case, numbers, or underscores.

Message: Invalid value for Variable Name
Description: Variable Name should follow limitations of SAS XPORT format v5. It should not exceed 8 characters and cannot contain characters other than letters in upper case, numbers, or underscores. It cannot start with a number.

Message: Variable label length is greater than 40 characters
Description: Variable Label should follow limitations of SAS XPORT format v5. It should not exceed 40 characters.
